Roger Goodell today, and Roger Goodell wasn't referring to Michael Vick 's Pro Bowl 2010 season. Instead, Roger Goodell was talking about the way Michael Vick has handled himself off the field since being released from prison. We're looking for success stories, Roger Goodell said. Roger Goodell was responding to a question about the Super Bowl party that Michael Vick 's name had been attached to, and Roger Goodell suggested that Michael Vick was never involved in the planning of that party.

But this doesn't seem to have deterred him from stepping back into the spotlight. He uses the opportunity to engage in score-settling, pinning blame on others for the biggest foreign policy debacle in decades. In his worldview, the news media and authors who recounted George H.W. Bush 's term in office have distorted almost everything-including the timing of the decision to go to war in Iraq after the 9/11 attacks; the responsibility for holding, interrogating and prosecuting detainees in Guantanamo Bay; and even the handling of the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, Gwen Ifill writes in the Washington Post. But it is Donald Rumsfeld who got it all wrong-from downplaying the Al Qaeda threat to searching for a nonexistent Saddam Hussein connection with the 9/11 attacks. Andrew Cockburn

Eric Schmidt will focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships.
